publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2692 Phil Gallie: Ayr United Football Stadium—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive's abandonment of its appeal against Heritage Scotland Ltd’s planning consent for Ayr United's new football stadium with related development, as granted by South Ayrshire Council and supported by the findings of the Scottish Executive initiated public inquiry, and urges the Scottish Executive to now record its approval for this consent, thereby allowing the building of the new stadium to be commenced at the earliest possible date. Supported by: Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2692 Ayr United Football Stadium (lodged on 4 February 2002) Kay Ullrich*, Alex Johnstone*, Murdo Fraser*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Alex Neil*, John Scott*
S1M-2692 Ayr United Football Stadium (lodged on 4 February 2002) Mr David Davidson*, Mr Keith Harding*, Mr John McAllion*, John Farquhar Munro*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*

S1M-2692 Phil Gallie: Ayr United Football Stadium—That the Parliament welcomes the Scottish Executive's abandonment of its appeal against Heritage Scotland Ltd’s planning consent for Ayr United's new football stadium with related development, as granted by South Ayrshire Council and supported by the findings of the Scottish Executive initiated public inquiry, and urges the Scottish Executive to now record its approval for this consent, thereby allowing the building of the new stadium to be commenced at the earliest possible date. Supported by: Mr Gil Paterson, Kay Ullrich, Alex Johnstone, Murdo Fraser, Mr Adam Ingram, Alex Neil, John Scott, Mr David Davidson, Mr Keith Harding, Mr John McAllion, John Farquhar Munro, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-2692 Ayr United Football Stadium (lodged on 4 February 2002) David McLetchie*
S1M-2692 Ayr United Football Stadium (lodged on 4 February 2002) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S1M-2692 Ayr United Football Stadium (lodged on 4 February 2002) Mr Brian Monteith*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2692 Ayr United Football Stadium (lodged on 4 February 2002) Brian Adam*
